intro: Sphaerostephanos dichrotrichoides, commonly known as the two-colored hairy stephanos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its hairy stems and two-toned leaves give it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
